item.description:

item.title: Large potholes and terrible road surface, 20th October
item.description:
These potholes have been there for at least 18 months if not longer. Reported by phone to the Council many times. Nothing done about them. Also the road markings for the parking bays has practically disappeared leading to inconsiderate parents from Barnehurst Schools parking 4 cars across the 2 bays thus blocking resident's driveways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coniston Close, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain., 20th October
item.description:
A builder poured concrete into a street drain and blocked it. water is now flooding the footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thurlow Park Road SE21 a few yards from Avenue Par, 20th October
item.description:
Thurlow Park Road SE21 a few yards from Avenue Park Road junction on the none house number 12 side ie the wooden hoarding side is a green plastic Lambeth road sweeper’s bag bin which is graffiti tagged – picture attached – please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor. I recognise Thurlow Park Road comes under Transport for London (TfL) but under the Environmental Protection Act (EPA) Lambeth is still responsible for general street litter / rubbish = Lambeth bin = Lambeth property = Lambeth graffiti to clean. (NB You do not remove graffiti from hoardings – this report is re Lambeth’s street sweeper’s bin being graffiti tagged.) Google Streetview of bin: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4405037,-0.1035664,3a,75y,223.14h,95.89t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sg0fWEKO5glKuwx_zRFftWg!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D-5.885371604612402%26panoid%3Dg0fWEKO5glKuwx_zRFftWg%26yaw%3D223.13541396402536!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTAxNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Park Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electricity box unlocked, 20th October
item.description:
Can pose a danger to children; they often play on the street, which has been kept open for some time—over a month. Also, a bicycle just abstracting the road. Children’s been playing with the bicycle, which can cause explosions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overton Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 20th October
item.description:
Again rubbish has been dumped here, several black bags of rubbish. Foxes have ripped open and cat litter over the pavement. Parents with prams and elderly people cannot pass due to this ongoing issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckler Gardens, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vandalised truck with fly tipped material and a broken window plus tons of leaves, 20th October
item.description:
It's been over two months since I first reported about the amount of leaves in our road and now it's been joined by an abandoned truck full of flight tipped material window broken collecting more vandalism around it and clearly the Bromley Council is failing us. Our road looks like a tip and I think it's about time that somebody came and cleared it all out and took the truck away. It obviously doesn't belong to anybody. It has been there for over 45 days and the leafs have been there since the summer and they're multiplying tenfold. We are unable to walk on the pavement because of the amount of leaves we are unable to park our cars properly because there's a lot of leaves between the park cars during the day Bromley Council we pay our taxes and you need to do something about this road which is getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 20th October
item.description:
There is a black Mitsubishi Jeep that’s been parked up outside No. 2 Wessex Drive since October 3rd. None of the occupants in the surrounding houses know whose vehicle this is and now the passenger side rear window has been smashed. We believe the vehicle may have been stolen and dumped. Vehicle Reg: DV16 YJO
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wessex Drive, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks signs blocking pavement, 20th October
item.description:
5 roadwork signs along the pavement. Pedestrians are forces to step in the road to get round. The other side footpath is closed so there is no safe system for pedestrians to walk along the road without stepping into the path of motor vehicles. I saw two elderly ladies nearly get hit by a car. The worst sign is the one telling drivers to stop at the red light. It covers the whole path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road West, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 20th October
item.description:
There is an abandoned vehicle parked up outside No. 2 Wessex Drive since 3rd October and none of the occupants of the surrounding houses know whose car this is and now the passenger side rear window has been smashed. Neighbours suspect it could have be stolen and dumped.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wessex Drive, North End, London
